ygData.subject: RE: Plane of losses
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh heh, no I do think its hopeless now.  That s not the part I find funny, its just that everyone who says its hopeless also says they are afraid to go there.
ygData.messageBody:
Heh heh, no I do think its hopeless now. That's not the part I find funny,
its just that everyone who says its hopeless also says they are afraid to go
there. I would think it is would be desireable that they'd be afraid to go
there but that they would go anyway and have some reasonable chance of
survival. The idea that groups could go off and wantonly kill a 'od like
Cazic Thule struck me as silly as in the old days of D&D some kEwL DoOd
would show up for a game with his own personal Mjolnir that he 'ripped' from
Thor's cold dead fingers. 'ods should kill you, by the dozens. If every
great hero in the land showed up and laid into the guy then maybe he should
die, but not without a lot of company. Just my personal opinion of course
and I'll leave it at that and save Talies the 'KABONG'

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 15, 1999 4:29 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Plane of losses


From: jhenders@...

On Wed, Sep 15/99, "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...> wrote:
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> No matter what they say I still find it hilarious that people consider it
a
> problem that they are afraid to go to the Plane of Fear. I feel for those
> who were slaughtered, but I think we should all be afraid to go there. It
> shouldn't be hopeless, but it should be feared, not merely viewed as a new
> place to get xp and cool items.
>

Umm. Do you somehow get the idea it's not currently hopeless? If you
want a real plane of fear that works like the current one but is a bit
cheaper on system resources they should just make a gate that kills you
and deletes your body when you use it. We currently have the same basic
effect. There's a big difference between really scarey and unplayable.
